intro: Jacquemontia guaranitica, commonly known as the Brazilian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible, bean-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its nocturnal blooming pattern and unique appearance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
